metadata.Title: CVE-2020-16587 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability exists in Academy SoftwareFoundation OpenEXR 2.3.0 in chunkOffsetReconstruction inImfMultiPartInputFile.cpp that can cause a denial of service via a craftedEXR file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-16587` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenexr22 - 2.2.0-10ubuntu2.4
openexr - 2.2.0-10ubuntu2.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openexr package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.0-10ubuntu2.4').
